key_channel_insights.line_content: 92% of Philippine Airlines’ website fares are invisible on OTAs, leaving revenue-critical markets under-represented.
Metasearch shows full fare coverage but 62% of quotes are marginally cheaper (-0.11%), creating a perception of better deals elsewhere without large revenue impact.
Three-quarters of GDS itineraries price above the website by an average 4%, with long-haul mark-ups doubling to 8%, risking share loss on high-value trips.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 92% of fares are missing on OTAs, widening by 0.6 ppts vs last month.
Of the 8% of itineraries displayed, 96% price-match the website; deviations average only ±0.14%.
Long-haul/non-PH origins hit 97% OTA coverage and >92% parity, but PH-origin routes remain entirely absent.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fare missing in 91.9% of checks (+0.6 ppts MoM).
Only 7.8% of comparisons match direct pricing, slipping 0.5 ppts MoM.
Undercuts (0.2%) and premiums (0.1%) are rare and average <0.15% variance.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA absent on 96.7% of routes; where present, prices stay within ±0.1% of the website.
‘Not-found’ fell to 50%; 48% parity and occasional 1.9% OTA discount.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 100% of fares missing, a persistent blind spot.
Only 3.5% not found; 92.9% parity with <1.2% deviations.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 91.6% missing; parity steady at 7.9% with ±0.2% variance.
Coverage slipped to 92.6% missing; parity down to 7.1%.

mse_highlights.line_content: 62% of ODs priced below the website, none above.
Average undercut is just ‑0.11%, signalling perception risk more than revenue loss.
Parity share rose 4.4 ppts WoW, led by short-haul and far-out bookings.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No ‘offer not found’ cases on MSE.
Undercuts eased 4.1 ppts WoW to 62.3%, averaging ‑0.11%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 98% undercutting persists, albeit a minimal ‑0.10% gap.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 59% undercutting at ‑0.10%; parity gained 4.8 ppts WoW.
99% priced lower at ‑0.17%; undercut share up 1 ppt WoW.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity majority at 56% (+9 ppts MoM); undercut gap narrowed to ‑0.08%.

gds_highlights.line_content: 75% of itineraries priced above the website with a 4% mark-up (+3.5 ppts WoW).
Long-haul premiums average 8% despite lower incidence (48%).
Outside PH, 86% parity and zero premiums indicate controlled distribution.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Premium share up 3.5 ppts WoW; average mark-up 4%.
‘Offer not available’ is low at 1.1% but nearly doubled WoW, signalling emerging issues.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 48% premiums but steeper 8% uplift; parity improved 6 ppts MoM to 42%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 82% premiums with 4% uplift; parity fell 3.9 ppts WoW.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premium frequency spikes to 87% with 5% uplift; parity shrinks to 11%.
